column2: Going to the clinic will help make sure that you and your baby stay healthy. Find out where your nearest clinic is today.
Your baby is the size of a lentil. He already has tiny hands and feet and his heart is beating.
Spotting or light bleeding is worrying but very common in pregnancy. If you have bleeding with pain, contact the clinic immediately.
Welcome. You have just missed your period, and you're already 5 weeks pregnant. Plan to go to the clinic soon.
Are you feeling sick? Most women do in early pregnancy. Try having some ginger, mint or lemon tea, and rest if you can.
Share the secret of your pregnancy with your health worker. She will give you iron and folic acid tablets to help your baby grow well.
Feeling dizzy? Sit down, eat and drink something, until you feel better. Get up slowly. Try to eat little and often.
Blood tests done at the clinic check your iron levels. You may be offered the tetanus vaccine and an HIV test
You may be feeling less sick about now. Your baby is the size of your thumb and is protected by the water he floats in, inside your womb.
